questions.title: Background
questions.text:
We are interested in studying how users learn to use computer applications. Specifically, after a user has become competent enough at using an application to no longer be considered a novice, how do they continue to learn new things about the application they are using.


For example, many people use Microsoft Word to complete their work, but not all users are aware of all the functionality Microsoft Word provides such as a bibliography manager, the ability to create charts, or the ability to find and replace all instances of a term.


We are interested in studying how people continue to learn about the functionality of applications, after they have already achieved competence.

questions.instructions: Do you try to learn new functionality when you use computer applications repeatedly?
When you consider applications that you frequently use, how many times a year do you learn something new about the application?
What are methods you use to learn new functionality? Check all that apply:

Read about it in an article
